items.title: Visualfiles Developer (remote working available)
items.content:
Visualfiles Developer (remote working available) - Jobmote

Visualfiles Developer (remote working available)

Anonymous

Capita are partnered with a global consultancy to help resource a Visualfiles Developer to work on-site with a legal sector client. This is a 6 month contract opportunity with immediate start available. The developer will spend one to two weeks with the technical team who are based in Manchester and after that the contract will be remote working.

We are looking for people with recent Visualfiles experience or case management experience (Aderant, Elite 3E). The developer must also come from a strong Microsoft background with C# VB template design.

Other Useful Skills

  • Openedge Administration
  • SOS Practice Manager Administration
  • Writing SQL queries
  • C#
  • VB
  • VB Script
  • MS Word template design
  • Workflow Analysis & Design

If you are available within a weeks' time, please apply with your latest CV.

Capita IT Resourcing is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy

items.title: Lead Developer
items.content:
Organisation - Third Way Legal (www.thirdway.pro)

Role - Lead / Full Stack Developer

Location - Bond Street / Marble Arch

Tools & Technologies:

Back-End:
• C# 6.0 Programming Language
• Microsoft SQL Server 2014 Database
• ADO.NET Data Access

Front-End:
• ASP.NET MVC 5.0
• Twitter Bootstrap 3.3.7 Responsive Front-End Framework
• HTML/CSS (LESS)/JavaScript (TypeScript)/jQuery

Company Description

Law firms and in-house legal teams spend hundreds of millions annually to attract the top legal candidates in the UK alone. But lawyers are terribly served by traditional recruitment agencies, who rely on anonymised web ads or inexperienced cold callers to engage potential legal recruits.

Our founders, Tom Balmer and David Crocker, have been involved in the establishment and growth of some of the best names in the legal recruitment industry since the early noughties. In 2017 they launched Third Way Legal, a marketplace platform designed to change the way lawyers engage with the jobs market.

Third Way is a unique network, where lawyers can confidentially see which firms are looking for lawyers like them (in some ways it is similar to workinginstartups.com!). Following an amazing first year, where we have grown to 6 people and are annualising a million in turnover, we now are looking to build an in-house tech team.

It's an extremely exciting time to join the business. We are expanding into the interim market, looking to grow into new geographies, and have so many new feature ideas it hurts. We're looking for a full-stack developer, comfortable with front and back end development, who is pragmatic and can eager to grow with the firm. If that sounds like you, and you'd like to join us on our journey to change the legal recruitment industry, please get in touch!

items.title: MyHub Intranet Solutions: DNN Web Developer - Work From Anywhere In The US
items.content:
DNN Web Developer - Work From Anywhere In The US

Posted May 11

MyHub Intranet Solutions
Headquarters: New Zealand
https://www.myhubintranet.com
View all MyHub Intranet Solutions jobs →

“Exciting International Software as a Service company with exceptional growth and prospects. Beat the daily commute, work from home anywhere in the US!”

Live the work/life balance dream, beat the daily commute, work from anywhere in the US. Based in Auckland New Zealand, we operate a 100% remote working policy with people based in the US and Europe. The company doesn’t just pay lip service to work-life balance, we live it every day, with flexible time throughout the day, to balance work and family commitments.

Please note: This is a permanent fulltime contacting role, the successful applicant will be paid monthly and will be entitled to up to 5 days sick leave and 4 weeks paid leave per annum. Medical and other benefits will not be provided by the company nor will computing equipment, however, an allowance for these items will be included in the monthly payment.

We have a vacancy for an experienced DNN Developer who will be tasked with helping the continued development of a well-established web-based product in the global marketplace. We are looking for an enthusiastic intermediate to senior level .Net web developer who has proven experience developing custom web-based solutions using the DNN framework.

The ideal candidate will also have experience in the hosting, optimization and scaling of the DNN CMS platform. Experience around the user experience and modern presentation layer best practices is also desirable.

Job Purpose

  • Play a key technical development role in helping shape the systems and processes associated with the development, support and delivery of new products, solutions and platforms.
  • Work with the management team to provide development solutions that will support online business development, product support, roadmap and marketing activities.

Key Responsibilities

  • The development and delivery of back and front-end code. This includes but is not limited to the development of C#, HTML, CSS, XML, JavaScript, JQuery, SQL queries and database design.
  • Delivery of front-end code designed for the best possible user experience. Where practical implementation of modern presentation layer best practices.
  • The development and delivery of hosting optimization, caching and scaling of the DNN CMS platform.
  • Continual development project progress reporting to line management.
  • De-risk the businesses software delivery lifecycle activities by working with other staff to ensure that proven methodologies are implemented and adhered to. Ensure that all backend and frontend code is delivered in line with modern best practices where practical.
  • Manage and where possible improve the development and change control processes across all environments and systems.
  • Work to resolve technical issues. Assist with the implementation of processes and policies to limit future occurrences.
  • Work with the management team to set goals designed to improve personal performance.
  • Work closely with both the management team and other technical resources using clear communications.
  • Play a key role from a development perspective in business analysis activities associated with the development of new products, solutions, platforms and internal business systems.
  • Where required ensure that requirements are effectively documented in order to de-risk delivery.
  • Proactively identify and communicate new product roadmap development and cost reduction opportunities for the business. Actively participate in the development and delivery of customer services solutions for the business as demand grows.
  • Work with the management team to help with the sourcing and onboarding of new technical staff into the business.

Requirements

  • DNN commercial development experience 2+ years
  • Several years .Net and MySQL commercial experience
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Knowledge of optimization, caching and scaling techniques
  • Experience using IIS, HTML (XHTML, HTML4/5), CSS, Media Queries, XML
  • Experience using modern JavaScript frameworks, jQuery
  • Familiarity of web usability and W3C standards
  • Experience working in an Amazon Web Services environment
  • Dedicated workspace to be able to work from home
  • High-speed home broadband connection
  • Very strong teamwork skills
  • Self-motivated problem solver with a strong work ethic
  • Ability to work remotely and survive long periods of time without physically seeing your co-workers (although you will be in daily communication with your team via email and video chat)
  • Some travel required

Apply for this position

If you think that you are up for the challenge and would like to discuss working with our awesome team, please get in touch. To be considered for this position can you please send your resume along with a cover letter outlining why you feel you will be suitable for the role to mike.mcminn@myhubintranet.com

items.title: OnePager: Front-End Software Engineer for Cloud App in .NET
items.content:
Front-End Software Engineer for Cloud App in .NET

Posted May 10

OnePager
Headquarters: Centennial, CO
http://www.onepager.com
View all OnePager jobs →

Join a high-powered group of people who write amazing graphics softwarefor project planners around the world.  Our customers love us because wemake communicating project plans so much easier.  We are anagile-methodology company and encourage flexible work arrangements. Most (butnot all) of us are in the Denver area, but we all work from home and gettogether in small groups when it makes sense.  Your job is to be a major contributor on our new SPA cloud app built with anASP.NET Core 2.0 back end.  This app is quite challengingbecause our customers expect it to be as powerful as our rich desktop apps.  Infact, it's likely that you've never worked on an app like this before.  We're looking for someone eager to meet the challenge of putting a high-function graphics application in the cloud.  Weare confident that we can get it to market and achieve success, but we could use your expertise especially if you've been down the SPA road and have learned some lessons from experience.

Minimum Required Skills:
  • 3-5 years experience with C#, JavaScript
  • Experience with ASP.NET MVC
  • Proven skills at software design, coding, unit-testing, troubleshooting,and customer interaction.

Desirable Experience:
  • Experience with Single-Page Applications in Angular, React, Vue.js, ... 
  • Experience with .Net Core 2.0

Other Job Requirements:
  • Strong English
  • Time zone: Mountain Standard Time (Denver) +- 3 hrs

Apply for this position

E-mail your resume, cover letter, location (country/time zone), and compensation requirements to careers@onepager.com. No telephone calls, third parties, or outsourcing proposals, please. Check out what we do at our web site: www.onepager.com.

items.title: Skapa Tech, LLC: Senior .NET Developer
items.content:
Senior .NET Developer

Posted May 10

Skapa Tech, LLC
Headquarters: Charlottesville, VA, USA
http://www.skapatech.com/
View all Skapa Tech, LLC jobs →

Skapa is an IT Consultancy specializing in the development of high-quality web-based applications. Skapa is seeking a multi-talented .NET developer to join their growing team. 

Job Description

Job Type: Contract (3-6 months)
Location: Remote/Home-based or Downtown Charlottesville, VA

We are seeking a mid-level to senior .NET developer responsible for adding new features to an existing ASP.NET WebForms site.  The main technologies are: ASP.NET WebForms (C# / Framework 4.6) and SQL Server. Your primary responsibility will be to develop both the front-end and back-end of the new features, and to coordinate with the rest of the team working on different layers of the infrastructure. A commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and quality product is essential.

The position has the potential to transition to a new ASP.NET Core/Reactjs application that is being developed concurrently.

Responsibilities
  • Translate application storyboards and use cases into functional applications
  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable code
  • Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
  • Provide timely updates on tasks and meet internal and client deadlines with high quality deliverables.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

Skills
  • Ability to work remotely with a quiet work environment
  • Self-directed
  • 5+ years of web development experience using ASP.NET WebForms
  • Strong knowledge of .NET web framework ASP.NET WebForms (C#)  
  • Strong Knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server and stored procedures 
  • Experience with popular web application frameworks
  • Understanding of fundamental design principles for building a scalable application
  • Experience creating the database schema that represent and support business processes
  • Understanding of entire development process, including specification, documentation, and quality assurance
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as git

Apply for this position

Please email your resume to: skapa.careers@skapatech.comUS citizens only; no recruiters or staffing agencies.

items.title: ASP.NET Web forms, C#, React magician - work Remote! (Swedish only) at e-Avrop AB (Stockholm, Sweden)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Student, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Business Intelligence, Business Process Optmization, Web Development
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

ASP.NET Web forms, REST APIs, React som vill jobba HEMIFRÅN!

Vi söker dig som älskar problemlösning/felsökning och programmering och vill ha ett stort inflytande över utvecklingen och god flexibilitet i tjänsten.

Du känner dig trygg i att jobba med en stor befintlig kodbas till stor del skriven i ASP.NET web forms och tycker det låter spännande att hitta sätt att utveckla den. Du kan rätta fel och lägga till features genom att programmera i befintlig teknik, men också vara med och driva utvecklingen för den nya produkten.

Du gillar förmodligen precis som oss att utforska och använda nya teknologier i utvecklingsarbetet mot framtidens webbapplikationer. Du har själv - på fritiden eller i tidigare jobb - arbetat med hela produkten från design, arkitektur, back-end och front-end till deployment. Kanske har du en publik GitHub med något spännande projekt!? 

Du har erfarenhet av ASP.NET web forms men också intresse av nyare teknologier. Vi gillar och tror att framtiden är att bygga snabba moduler i med frond-end i React.

Vårt företag
På e-Avrop utvecklar vi ett omfattande IT-stöd för upphandling, där svenska och utländska myndigheter, kommuner och företag får hjälp med hela upphandlingsprocessen.

Vår produkt har mängder av spännande funktionalitet såsom visuella processmodeller, rättighetsstyrd dokumenthantering, och realtidslösning för auktioner. Vi ser också många möjligheter för framtidens utveckling, med både business intelligence, machine learning och annat smart användande av vår samlade data. Allt för att kunna erbjuda nya och bättre tjänster inom området.

Vårt mål är att utveckla en enkel och kraftfull plattform med stor flexibilitet för upphandlare och företag. Vårt fokus ligger i att användarupplevelsen ska kännas modern, snabb och ha genomtänkt gränssnitt. 

När vi träffas ses vi i trivsamma lokaler på Östermalm i Stockholm, ett stenkast från Tekniska Högskolan. Övrig tid jobbar vi effektivt hemifrån, med dagliga scrum-möten online.

Arbetsuppgifter
Den huvudsakliga arbetsuppgiften är underhåll av den befintliga web-applikationen för upphandlingsstöd samt viss nyutveckling i varierande teknologier. Vi jobbar i korta sprintar med prioriterad backlog.

Arbetet omfattar hela kedjan från rent underhållsarbete och bug-rättningar till feature requests med design av gränssnitt, datamodell, och teknisk lösning.

Vår utveckling sker främst i .Net-miljö (ASP.NET web forms) men mycket av våra nyare lösningar innefattar modernare gränssnitt skrivna i React, AngularJS och ren javascript. Vi använder självklart senaste verktygen såsom Visual Studio Resharper/Rider och Webstorm. Vi kör både macOS och Windows och hanterar kod med GitFlow. Vi har ett agilt tänk och har i nuläget en helt automatisk byggprocess och deployment.

Din profil
Vi tror att du är civilingenjör, datavetare eller motsvarande och har arbetat ett par år med systemutveckling. Du är van med att implementera webbservices och andra API:er såsom REST med flera och har goda kunskaper inom webbtekniker. Vidare tror vi att du har erfarenhet inom .NET, ASP web forms, C# och javascriptsbaserade front-end teknologier. 

För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du är analytiskt lagd, har ett strukturerat arbetssätt med en adaptiv syn på teknologi. Du kan arbeta självständigt och i grupp samt har lätt för att sätta dig in i, förstå och använda nya verktyg och koncept inom systemutveckling. Du behärskar både svenska samt engelska obehindrat i tal och skrift. Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.

Din ansökan
Stämmer detta in på dig? Ansök redan idag, dock senast den 12 november 2017. Vi anställer löpande. I din ansökan ber vi dig inkludera CV samt personligt brev. Har du frågor om tjänsten kontakta oss på jobb@e-avrop.com eller ring och prata med vår VD Ernest Wessman på tel. 070-7277000.

Välkommen med din ansökan!


e-Avrop är ett företag som hjälper våra kunder att förenkla, effektivisera och kvalitetssäkra sin upphandlings- och avtalsprocess. e-Avrops affärsidé är att erbjuda ett elektroniskt upphandlings- och avtalsstöd för offentlig sektor som hjälper våra kunder att på ett enkelt, effektivt och kvalitetssäkert sätt hantera upphandlingar och avtal. Vidare erbjuder e-Avrop mervärdestjänster i form av konsulttjänster inom området offentlig upphandling. e-Avrop är en branschledande aktör på nationell nivå och vi är stolta över att vara pionjärer i branschen, en position som vi har uppnått genom att vara innovativa, pålitliga och kundvänliga. Läs mer på: www.e-avrop.com

Benefits

Ha stort inflytande över produkt och utveckling
Flexibel arbete med möjlighet till deltidsarbete hemifrån
Bidrag till träning och fitness
Arbeta med de senaste verktygen som du gillar bäst

items.title: Senior Back End Architect/Engineer at CentralReach
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Enterprise Software, Healthcare
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

We are looking for a few great back end architects/developers to join our team.  Although we have offices in Pompano Beach, FL, you can work full-time from anywhere in the comfort of your own home (or join us in the office if you prefer, full relocation provided).  Senior (and very senior, and very very senior) level architects/developers with anywhere from 5 thru 20+ years experience are welcome to apply. Though we do not hire based on specific languages or technologies, we primarily utilize standard web technologies (JavaScript, React, etc.) and the Microsoft development stack (C#, SQL Server) on AWS (using Redis, ElasticSearch, Redshift, DynamoDb, Kinesis, etc.).

You should:

  • Have a passion for server/api/data development and technology in general
  • Enjoy and thrive in an agile, fast-moving, ever-changing startup environment
  • Welcome and take on technical challenges of all shapes and sizes
  • Be comfortable working in a distributed, semi-virtual environment
  • Be capable of creating and executing on technical direction and tasks for yourself and others
  • Be able to take minimal direction from others and provide maximal output for yourself (and others)
  • Have excellent interpersonal skills and a sense of humor

You will (just as we all do):

  • Develop back-office software, systems, and API's in an agile environment to integrate with a growing set of practice management software solutions
  • Take ownership of bringing new and improved features and functionality to our entire stack
  • Work independently within a group of developers to drive product development
  • Communicate and coordinate effectively with other independent techies and non-techies alike to ensure optimal progress towards our goals

You must:

  • Demonstrate solid working knowledge of any mainstream object oriented programming language, ideally C#, C++, Java.
  • Have a deep understanding of back end/server/api development, including application and database/data development and architectures
  • Possess broad applicable knowledge of data/database technologies including traditional RDBMS's (SQL Server), NoSql (DynamoDb), Search (ElasticSearch), Analytics/Warehousing (Redshift, EMR), Streaming (Kinesis), etc.
  • Display working knowledge of the SQL language and/or SQL-based relational database system(s) (i.e. MySql, SQL Server, Oracle, etc.)
  • Have a solid command of written and spoken English

The Perks:

  • Work from the comfort of your home or in our office in Pompano Beach, FL
  • Work in an office (when you are in the office anyhow) that understands and values techies. No cubicles, no unnecessary meetings, the freedom to produce results, excellent hardware, and people that laugh at your techie jokes
  • Responsibility for your output (and the corresponding accountability)
  • Attractive compensation
  • Other great teammates you will learn from (and vice versa)

About CentralReach

At CentralReach our mission is to redefine the way patients, providers, and payers connect, coordinate, and collaborate in care. CentralReach went live in January of 2013 and it now one of the nation's fastest growing health tech startups. Its proven incredibly viral for providers wanting to share information about their patients and critical to businesses trying to manage and grow.

Benefits

Above-market Pay
100% Medical Deductible Paid (Individual)
Telecommute Policy
20+ PTO Days a Year
Top notch techie equipment and software
Live By Beach (or wherever you happen to be)
Small, dynamic team
Vision, Dental, AD&D, Teladoc, etc.

items.title: Software Engineering Manager at Crossover
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Computer Software, Enterprise Software, Software Consulting
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Aurea takes an unorthodox approach to hiring in an attempt to improve the candidate experience by expediting the hiring process through an innovate online hiring tournament. Candidates will receive an offer as soon as the day of the event should they be successful.

We're running an Online Hiring Tournament on May 12th to hire Software Engineering Managers (USD $100K/yr) with expertise in SaaS OR QA OR Java OR .NET OR Ruby on Rails.

This event will include all testing for the role. Upon grading the deliverables from the event, we will set up qualified candidates with an interview with the hiring manager. This is a 100% remote, full-time role.

The Software Engineering Manager will serve as a key member of the global executive team for Aurea or one of its affiliated sister companies and will be responsible for quarterly high-quality product delivery. As part of the leadership team, you will be expected to run an engineering organization using a revolutionary and radically differentiated process. With a focus on small, great global teams, productivity, factory-like process, and quantifiable business impact, you will be expected to drive higher levels of value and productivity from your engineering organization than most companies would expect to achieve. You must build, develop and engage a team from a global talent pool. In doing so, you must set an agenda for the function where the teams effectively and efficiently solve some of the most challenging software problems with engineers distributed around the globe. You will leverage your personal technical depth as a as a former developer and architect in order to set a personal standard for Computer Science excellence, to push your teams and to assess the talent base you need to maintain.

You will be tested in one of the following technologies based on your expertise:

  • SaaS
  • QA
  • Java
  • .NET
  • Ruby on Rails

Candidate Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science (MS or PhD preferred) is absolutely mandatory.
  • 15+ years of engineering experience leading multiple teams across multiple products and technologies — this is a global leadership role for a seasoned software development leader, not a first executive role for a great software development manager
  • Experience is Software Engineering focused instead of product management
  • Proven experience in building high-performance teams and scalable best engineering practices
  • Spent 5 years in hands-on Java or .NET architecture and programming in a hands-on, development-intensive individual contributor role
  • Recent experience with DevOps and Cloud architecture. We live in the Cloud.
  • Experience with high-end enterprise systems deployed in environments of Global 100 corporation complexity

We recommend that you attend the tournament instead of applying online, as our tournament process will be much faster.

Click Apply Now > Register at the green button - you will receive the webinar link after completing registration.

Benefits

Work from anywhere
Choose your own hours
Flat organization
Work with talented people all over the world
Committed to diversity
Competitive compensation

items.title: Software Architects at Crossover
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Computer Software, Enterprise Software, Software Consulting
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

ESW Capital takes an unorthodox approach to hiring in an attempt to improve the candidate experience by expediting the hiring process through an innovate online hiring tournament. Candidates will receive an offer as soon as the day of the event should they be successful.

We're running an Online Hiring Tournament on May 12th to hire Software Architects (USD $60K/yr) with expertise in Cloud OR Java OR .NET OR C++ OR Front End. If you are not familiar with any of those technologies, you should not attend the event as we currently have openings only in those roles.

This event will include testing. Upon grading the deliverables from the event, we will set up qualified candidates with an interview with the hiring manager, who can hire 30 Architects that week. This is a 100% remote, full-time role.

This position is with ESW Capital or one of its affiliated companies.

You will be part of a team responsible for the architecture and technical delivery of a multi-million dollar revenue per year enterprise software product. That team is responsible to ensure that the customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and quality of the product. We want to give you the ability to look at code in ways it has never been looked at before, to understand the interdependency in the code.
We are empowering software development and creating higher quality code by using the latest technologies and toolsets. We are excited about using data to make decisions, we are bringing big data and analysis to software development. We are on the cutting edge of software development, and we innovate improvements on the newest technologies. We want people who are adaptable and can learn new things, and can use new ideas and concepts to solve business problems.

You will be tested in one of the following technologies based on your expertise:

  • Java
  • Cloud
  • .NET
  • Front End
  • C++

Candidate Requirements:

  • 5+ years of experience as both a hands-on architect and a software engineer

items.title: Senior Backend and .NET Developer at trade.io
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Cryptocurrency, Financial Technology, Forex Trading
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

Summary

              Trade.io is looking for a senior-level US-based back-end developer (C# .NET Core) to join our globally distributed team.  This person will be working closely with the Engineering Department management to build and maintain mission-critical applications and services, including the trade.io exchange.  The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding and appreciation for development best practices and good application architecture, as well as a strong drive for excellence.  They should be open and able to learn new technologies relatively quickly based on the application requirements. This person should have a basic or higher understanding of cryptocurrencies and trading (crypto, forex, or stocks).

Starting Salary is $85 – 120k depending on experience.  This is a remote position.

Requirements

  • Advanced understanding of .NET Core
  • At least 4 years of experience with app development using backend frameworks
  • Bachelor’s Degree or additional equivalent experience
  • Native English speaker or equivalent level of fluency
  • Knowledge of object-oriented and SaaS paradigms and best practices
  • Basic understanding of trading (order types, candlestick charts, technical analysis, etc)
  • Basic understanding of the crypto community

Nice to Have

  • Proficiency with other frameworks and languages such as Ruby, Crystal, Go, and Node.js
  • Experience with MVC and frontend technologies
  • Experience with order matching software
  • History of involvement with Open Source community
  • Experience with Azure
  • Likes to use animated GIFs in Slack

About trade.io

trade.io is a next generation financial institution based on blockchain technology, providing the ultimate in security and transparency. By leveraging decades of experience in the investment banking, trading & fintech sectors, and combining them with the power and transparency of the distributed ledger, we’ve created a truly unique product that will revolutionize asset trading and investment banking. As well as asset trading, the trade.io exchange supports a more efficient and secure method of listing assets in the crypto economy, using the trusted record keeping capabilities that only blockchain provides. This is coupled with trade.io’s investment banking and advisory expertise and the reassurance that comes with operating in a regulated environment. Ultimately, trade.io will be a trading and financing platform for more than just crypto assets. It will also offer Forex and CFDs over precious metals, oil, commodities, indices, global equities, to name just a few. Offering more than 120 products at launch, trade.io will have the capacity to trade any number of assets.

Benefits

Remote Team
Paid Vacation
Competitive Salaries

items.title: Bakpax | REMOTE | Senior Software Engineer | Do good, help teachers!
items.content:
Bakpax | REMOTE | Senior Software Engineer | Do good, help teachers!

We are a stealth-mode education technology startup using AI and Big Data to improve the lives of K-12 teachers and students.

Teachers are overworked and underappreciated. Bakpax wants to help carry some of the load.

We were started by the founder of adaptive learning giant Knewton, the head of global content marketing for Outbrain, and the head of engineering for Arena, a healthcare predictive analytics company.

We have investments from the leading edtech VC firm, Owl Ventures, the co-founder of Twitter's firm, Obvious Ventures, and the co-founder of LinkedIn's firm, Greylock Partners.

You will work with a small team of other very experienced engineers to get everything off the ground. From a computer vision and natural language processing pipeline, to the web API to the deployment & config system — it all needs to be built. This will be very fun to build, and you will be a hero to your teacher family members & friends

Read the full job description here: https://www.bakpax.com/jobs/ and email your interest to jobs@bakpax.com.

Come work with us!

Experience level: Lead, Manager
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Computer Software, Enterprise Software, Software Consulting
Company size: 51-200 people

Job description

Aurea takes an unorthodox approach to hiring in an attempt to improve the candidate experience by expediting the hiring process through an innovate online hiring tournament. Candidates will receive an offer as soon as the day of the event should they be successful.

We're running an Online Hiring Tournament on May 5th to hire Java Software Engineering Managers (USD $100K/yr).

This event will include all testing for the role. Upon grading the deliverables from the event, we will set up qualified candidates with an interview with the hiring manager. This is a 100% remote, full-time role.

The Software Engineering Manager will serve as a key member of the global executive team for Aurea or one of its affiliated sister companies and will be responsible for quarterly high-quality product delivery. As part of the leadership team, you will be expected to run an engineering organization using a revolutionary and radically differentiated process. With a focus on small, great global teams, productivity, factory-like process, and quantifiable business impact, you will be expected to drive higher levels of value and productivity from your engineering organization than most companies would expect to achieve. You must build, develop and engage a team from a global talent pool. In doing so, you must set an agenda for the function where the teams effectively and efficiently solve some of the most challenging software problems with engineers distributed around the globe. You will leverage your personal technical depth as a as a former developer and architect in order to set a personal standard for Computer Science excellence, to push your teams and to assess the talent base you need to maintain.

Candidate Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science (MS or PhD preferred) is absolutely mandatory.
  • 15+ years of engineering experience leading multiple teams across multiple products and technologies — this is a global leadership role for a seasoned software development leader, not a first executive role for a great software development manager
  • Experience is Software Engineering focused instead of product management
  • Proven experience in building high-performance teams and scalable best engineering practices
  • Spent 5 years in hands-on Java or .NET architecture and programming in a hands-on, development-intensive individual contributor role

items.title: Microsoft Data/Analytics Solution Consultant (Remote)
items.content:
Microsoft Data/Analytics Solution Consultant (Remote) - Jobmote

Microsoft Data/Analytics Solution Consultant (Remote)

BlueGranite

BlueGranite's Solution Consultant position is a mid-level role for individuals with at least three years of professional experience developing data/analytics solutions on the Microsoft platform.

BlueGranite Solution Consultants possess talent for envisioning and realizing the delivery of value through Microsoft's SQL Server, Power BI, and Azure platforms. Solution Consultants work on project teams led by Senior Consultants and Architects to design, implement, and support data and analytics solutions for our clients.

This full-time, work-from-home consultant position is for individuals who enjoy working on project teams building data and analytics solutions using the Microsoft platform.

At a minimum, we're looking for:

  • At least 3 years of hands-on, professional experience with Microsoft data/analytics platforms
  • Knowledge of data warehouse concepts and dimensional modeling techniques
  • Experience developing reports or dashboards
  • Strong aptitude with T-SQL statements and DAX functions
  • Self-starter, quick learner, with a positive, collaborative, and team-based attitude
  • Excellent communication skills, with interests in presenting and blogging
  • Degree in information technology, computer science, business, or engineering
  • Ability to travel across the U.S., with an average of 25% travel to client locations per year
  • Ability to work from home when not on-site at client locations
  • Authorization to work in the U.S., without the requirement for an employment visa

In addition, these score you extra points:

  • Microsoft or other industry certifications for BI, DW, or analytics
  • Microsoft Azure, Power BI, or big data knowledge/experience
  • Interest in advanced analytics, machine learning, and languages including R and Python
  • Demonstration of thought leadership, community volunteering, recognition or awards
  • Master's degree in technology or business

Your primary responsibilities would include:

  • Developing data and analytics solutions using Microsoft SQL, Power BI, and Azure
  • Creating informative and interactive data visualizations/models
  • Utilizing key components of SQL Server (such as SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, MDS/DQS, R Server)
  • Leveraging Azure Data Services and Power BI to deliver cloud solutions
  • Writing relational and multidimensional database queries, flows and movements
  • Obtaining and maintaining technical certifications in these core areas of expertiseBlueGranite is the driving force of data innovation for our customers. We are trusted advisors who use our aptitude and experience to deliver value to our clients. We invest in our team to become better at who we are and what we do. Our core strategy is to lead with offers for data, insights, and analytics that deliver business value on the Microsoft platform.

This position is predominantly remote, work from home, with an average of 25% overnight travel per year. BlueGranite employees are located in Michigan, Illinois, Indiana, Ohio, Colorado, Texas, Minnesota, Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina, New York, New Hampshire, Florida, or Massachusetts only.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

The Trade Desk | Full Time, Onsite & Remote | New York NY, San Jose CA, San Francisco CA, Aliso Viejo CA, Ventura CA, Boulder CO, Denver CO, Bellevue WA, London UK, Sydney AUS, Shanghai CN

Hiring: All levels of software engineers, as well as front-end focused developers who are comfortable with data-access design, development and optimization. You might be a great fit for The Trade Desk's dev team if:

You are a full-stack engineer who wants to work everywhere, not just a small subset of components. Experience / interest in working in a variety of layers and technologies within a SOA is a must for our team. This includes: client-side React & Redux, MVC-based web architecture, external RESTful APIs, distributed (and in our case, highly scaled) request handling services, no-SQL and relational SQL databases, many-layered data pipeline (e.g. data bus architecture, Hadoop / MPP data warehouse, etc.) that moves hundreds of thousands of items per second, and data visualization (e.g. Tableau). Experience in all these layers is not strictly required, but we do like to see experience working in more than one, as well as eagerness to work on projects that might slice through them all.

* You have product-driven software development experience using a modern, object-oriented language. Memory-managed languages are best -- .e.g. C#, Java, Python, Ruby, etc. We do most of our work in C#/.Net, but specific experience here is not required.

Cool stuff about TTD:

* Our platform processes 8million+ queries per second

* Work with the best engineering team in AdTech

* The combination of huge data sets, high throughput, low latency and amazing scale means that we're constantly solving some of the biggest challenges in computer science.

* We've grown faster than any other adtech company in the industry, and have been recently recognized as one of the fastest growing companies in America by Inc. Magazine and Deloitte.

* Amazing Company Culture

* Top-tier benefits

If you're interested, please apply directly on our website: https://www.thetradedesk.com/join-us/open-positions

*Note: We are also hiring NoSQL DBA;s (Aerospike - remote or onsite), SQL DBA's, entry level Site Reliability Engineers (Boulder CO and Ventura CA), Mid-Senior Level Site Reliability Engineers (all levels - remote or onsite), Business Intelligence Analysts (NYC, Sydney AUS), Integrations Managers (NYC), Sr. Data Scientists (Boulder CO, NYC, London, Ventura CA), Application Support (NYC, Ventura CA).

items.title: BAMTech Media | New York, NY | Software Engineer or Senior Software Engineer: Media Services; Senior Software Engineer: Stream ...
items.content:
BAMTech Media | New York, NY | Software Engineer or Senior Software Engineer: Media Services; Senior Software Engineer: Stream Security || ONSITE or REMOTE, Full time

Join our team and help us drive the cord-cutting revolution! BAMTech isn’t just about streaming Baseball – we also manage NHL, Fox Sports Go, WWE, Eurosport, and several other content providers. You would be helping a team whose services act as the linchpin for video playback, handling new challenges of scale and speed in a rapidly growing industry. The company is aggressively expanding to meet increased demand, and you would be getting in on the ground floor of this new opportunity. You would help the team create new designs to meet our scaling demands, build out services in cloud infrastructure providers with exposure to AWS EC2, S3, Dynamo, and Kinesis, and help the team introduce new processes to scale. If you like tinkering with new technologies, have experience with high scale systems, or simply want to gain exposure to new tools, this team is a great fit. You’d be helping the team embrace microservices architecture with an emphasis on non-blocking, highly concurrent programming. Experience with Scala/Play/Akka is highly preferred, but not a requirement. With strong CS fundamentals and an entrepreneurial attitude, you’d be an asset to our team.

We are also seeking a Senior Engineer with C#/.NET experience to join our Stream Security team. This team is responsible protecting our content, with projects that span a wide variety of security concepts including studio grade DRM. We're looking for a candidate with C#/.NET experience but also an openness to expand into Scala. This is a unique opportunity in a high visibility team with significant impact.

PM me to apply.

Read more here: https://www.bamtechmedia.com/

items.title: Lingumi (https://www.lingumi.com) | London, UK | Software Engineer | Full-time | GBP 30-40k + equity | INTERN, ONSITE We’re a fast-growing EdTech ...
items.content:
Lingumi (https://www.lingumi.com) | London, UK | Software Engineer | Full-time | GBP 30-40k + equity | INTERN, ONSITE

We’re a fast-growing EdTech startup with a mission to make English learning fun, affordable and effective for the next billion young learners. Our flagship product is a mobile app with a digital curriculum full of mini-games for 2-6 year-olds making their first steps into English (as a second language).

We’re looking for our fourth engineer to help us iterate on the app (Unity, C#) and build out our backend systems (AWS, node.js) to deal with scaling globally and personalizing the experience for every child. We're a team of ten, with an open work culture that permits flexible working time, remote-friendly work, and team members with young families.

We’re iterating on our hiring process to be both fair and effective for both parties, but roughly speaking it works like this: application, take-home technical challenge, phone call, on-sites/video calls, offer.

The full job specification and application form can be found here: https://lingumi.workable.com/j/8727CCF3F9. If you’re looking for an internship, email me directly at george (at) lingumi (dot) com.

Disclaimer: We’re not yet able to sponsor visas, therefore we don’t want to waste anyone’s time by promising on something we can’t deliver. Similarly, although we do support remote employees, we’re not able to include candidates who are not able to start off in one of our offices (for onboarding). We have offices in Cardiff and London.

I’m one of the software engineers on the team, but I’ll also be handling the recruitment process so I welcome questions about the company, the team, the engineering and the application process via an email to george (at) lingumi (dot) com or a comment below!

items.title: Prescience Health: Sr. Software Engineer | ASP.NET, Javascript | US Based Only
items.content:
Sr. Software Engineer | ASP.NET, Javascript | US Based Only

Posted Apr 25

Prescience Health
Headquarters: Chicago, IL
http://www.presciencehealth.io
View all Prescience Health jobs →

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our small engineering team at Prescience Health. Want to help hospitals improve the quality of patient care, manage labor costs, and enhance nurse satisfaction? Then keep reading!

As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll have a wide breadth of responsibility ranging from developing our SaaS offerings to integrating our solutions with existing healthcare systems and redesigning our microservices. You’ll be working directly with hospitals and platform partners including a Fortune 15 company.

Things You Might Do:

  • Prototype and build new technologies to optimize or completely replace existing platform components.
  • Assist with algorithm development to transform real-time patient and staffing data into actionable insights.
  • Develop, test and deploy custom integrations to various healthcare software systems including EMR, staffing and scheduling, and payroll systems.
  • Refactor or improve existing code and architecture to improve the performance of the forecasting engine.
  • Help put tools, processes, and documentation in place to improve our code quality.

What We’re Looking For:

  • Minimum 5+ years of related full-time experience.
  • Bachelors in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or equivalent experience.
  • Experience in C#, ASP.NET, Javascript, MS Entity Framework, LINQ, T-SQL, Stored Procedures, and SSIS.
  • Experience working with forecasting algorithms (time series analysis).
  • Excellent communication skills.

It Would Be Even More Awesome If You Had:

  • Familiarity with deploying applications on Microsoft Azure.
  • Experience working in healthcare IT.
  • Familiarity with Telerik, SSRS, HL7, or ETL.
  • Experience with data visualization and analytics.
  • Interest and experience in front-end UI/UX design.

Location and Compensation:

Location: Anywhere in the United States
Compensation:
  • Competitive salary.
  • Equity options.
  • Unlimited vacation policy.
  • Pick your own equipment.

Application Process:

We have a non-standard application process. Once we screen your application and resume, you will have a virtual interview with our CTO, Scott Duncan. While we reach out to your references, you will also have a virtual interview with our CEO, Hiro Kawashima.

We don’t believe in free homework assignments or work. To help determine mutual fit, we will offer a short term paid project (we pay market rate!). Upon the conclusion of the project, we can both decide if we would like to proceed with a full time opportunity.

Apply for this position

Please send a resume to hiro@presciencehealth.io. We are currently only accepting applications from: (1) individuals residing in the United States; (2) individuals interested in a full time position (no contractors); and (3) no companies or recruiters.

items.title: Software Engineering Manager (SaaSOps, Java, .NET, QA, Python) at Crossover
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Lead, Manager
Role: QA/Test Developer
Industry: Computer Software, Enterprise Software, Software Consulting
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Aurea takes an unorthodox approach to hiring in an attempt to improve the candidate experience by expediting the hiring process through an innovate online hiring tournament. Candidates will receive an offer as soon as the day of the event should they be successful.

We're running an Online Hiring Tournament on April 28th to hire Software Engineering Managers (USD $100K/yr) with expertise in SaaSOps OR Java OR .NET OR QA OR Python.

This event will include all testing for the role. Upon grading the deliverables from the event, we will set up qualified candidates with an interview with the hiring manager. This is a 100% remote, full-time role.

The Software Engineering Manager will serve as a key member of the global executive team for Aurea or one of its affiliated sister companies and will be responsible for quarterly high-quality product delivery. As part of the leadership team, you will be expected to run an engineering organization using a revolutionary and radically differentiated process. With a focus on small, great global teams, productivity, factory-like process, and quantifiable business impact, you will be expected to drive higher levels of value and productivity from your engineering organization than most companies would expect to achieve. You must build, develop and engage a team from a global talent pool. In doing so, you must set an agenda for the function where the teams effectively and efficiently solve some of the most challenging software problems with engineers distributed around the globe. You will leverage your personal technical depth as a as a former developer and architect in order to set a personal standard for Computer Science excellence, to push your teams and to assess the talent base you need to maintain.

You will be tested in one of the following technologies based on your expertise:

  • Java
  • C# (.NET)
  • SaaSOps
  • Python
  • QA

Candidate Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science (MS or PhD preferred) is absolutely mandatory.
  • 15+ years of engineering experience leading multiple teams across multiple products and technologies — this is a global leadership role for a seasoned software development leader, not a first executive role for a great software development manager
  • Experience is Software Engineering focused instead of product management
  • Proven experience in building high-performance teams and scalable best engineering practices
  • Spent 5 years in hands-on Java or .NET architecture and programming in a hands-on, development-intensive individual contributor role
  • Recent experience with DevOps and Cloud architecture. We live in the Cloud.
  • Experience with high-end enterprise systems deployed in environments of Global 100 corporation complexity

We recommend that you attend the tournament instead of applying online, as our tournament process will be much faster.

Click Apply Now > Register at the green button - you will receive the webinar link after completing registration.

Benefits

Work from anywhere
Choose your own hours
Flat organization
Work with talented people all over the world
Committed to diversity
Competitive compensation

Job description

Authority Partners is seeking an experienced Xamarin Developer to join our strong development team. The Xamarin Developer will design and write maintainable code, communicate with teams and clients, as well as deliver products within an aggressive schedule.

A competitive salary
Flexible working hours with some options for remote working
Exposure to cutting edge technology
If this sounds like something that you might be interested in send your CV ASAP so that we can arrange a time to speak!

We are seeking a Software Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be a team player, with strong initiative, autonomy and quick to learn.

Must have skills
• Bachelor/Masters Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience
• 4 to 6+ years of experience in Microsoft Web technologies - experience in Microsoft .NET technologies NET 4.5, C#, ASP.NET Core, ASP.NET MVC
• Strong concept object oriented Programming
• 2-4+ years experience working with MongoDB/noSQL - database architecture, design and development for unstructured data

items.title: GivingData: Web Application Developer
items.content:
Web Application Developer

Posted Apr 23

GivingData
Headquarters: Boston. MA
https://GivingData.com
View all GivingData jobs →

Not your typical start-up. Join a small and growing software and consulting company serving the social sector. We’ve built (and continue to build) an enterprise-class data management and analytics product serving some of the largest foundations and grantmaking organizations in North America.

Our team is located all around the country: Boston, New York, Seattle, and Pittsburgh. Geographically dispersed, but highly collaborative, you’ll be working alongside seasoned developers building desktop and mobile apps in .NET, AngularJS, and Bootstrap.

We’re a for profit organization supporting the mission-based work of our clients who invest millions each year in health, the environment, education, human rights, the arts, and research. Apply your skills and knowledge to a different kind of bottom line and come build an innovative product with us while supporting the work of amazing organizations working to improve our world.

We’re looking for a smart, energetic developer who’s a quick study, a creative problem solver, and plays nice with others.

  • Microsoft Azure Web Apps, Database and Infrastructure skills.
  • ORM Experience (NHibernate or Entity Framework)

  • JavaScript libraries (Highcharts, Datatables)

  • We are only accepting applicants who reside in the United States.

Apply for this position

Send a cover letter and résumé to devjobs@givingdata.com.

items.title: Windows (UWP) Developer
items.content:
Company

At TopHatch, we delight and empower creative people. Our powerful, award-winning design tools simplify the creative process with smarter, more intuitive technology. You could say we’re building the future of design. And we’d love your help. Check out Concepts in the App Store: https://appstore.com/conceptssmartersketching

Role

We're on the lookout for an experienced Windows developer to work on developing Concepts for Windows (UWP). We are looking for someone who is passionate about building great mobile software. Someone who loves to hack, but can then turn this into a high quality, stable deliverable that our customers will love. Someone who is comfortable iterating on a feature until it is done, however many cycles that takes. Maybe that's you?

Responsibilities

  • The role is focussed on user interface development using XAML and C#, but an ability to understand and write C++ would be beneficial.

  • Collaborating closely with other team members to define, design, develop, test and deliver the Concepts experience on Windows.

  • Delivering a quality software solution using an agile mobile development cycle. We ship fast and often; you’ll need to be able to roll with it.

  • Analyzing business requirements, providing development estimates and feedback on risk.

Location

Our preference is to employ someone in a location that we already have employees, so our Turku office in Finland, or a remote position in USA, UK, Spain or Romania. But for the right person we will hire you wherever you are.

Key Skills

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. You'll need to be a confident communicator, happy to work daily on Slack/Github to report progress and issues with local and remote team members.

  • An understanding of the importance of visual and interaction design, and a willingness to work closely with designers to deliver great user experiences.

  • 3+ years active work in software development

  • 3+ years as an Windows developer (any XAML/C# platform - UWP Preferred)

  • Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision in a collaborative work environment.

items.title: Healthcare Interoperability Software Developer/Architect at CareEvolution (Ann Arbor, MI)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Health Care, Software Development
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Note: this job is open to US Residents only.  Foreign nationals can apply but only if you live within the US.

Does what you do matter? Is the work that you do making a difference in the world?

What CareEvolution does actually matters. Our HIEBus platform helps patients attain better health outcomes.

Simply stated, at CareEvolution, you will craft web and mobile applications for healthcare. Under the covers, though, a lot more is going on - we have developed a robust software platform that ingresses data, programmatically links that data across institutions on a per-patient basis, and supplies APIs to consume, project, modify, and aggregate that data in all sorts of interesting and useful ways. You can read our company page for a more detailed explanation of our mission and culture.

We are looking for software developers to help us:

  • build out our platform
  • write IHE Profile data adapters (drivers) to automatically ingress data from hundreds of data sources - both batched and in real time
  • craft the next generation of healthcare apps
  • identify the real needs of our customers, and execute on them accurately and quickly.
  • be technical sherpas helping customers connect to us

At CareEvolution, we don't give you things to work on. Part of your work at CareEvolution determining your work: you decide what to do. We've designed our organization specifically to promote creativity, innovation, and focus on solving some of the hardest challenges in healthcare.

Visit http://letsfixhealthcare.com to learn more - or contact us (resume@careevolution.com) - and we'll explain what CareEvolution is all about.

We'd love to talk to you if:

  • You have experience with healthcare technologies like CDA/CCD/CCDA; IHE profiles like PIX, XDS, XCPD, XCA, XDR; and HL7
  • You have the drive, excitement, and empathy to guide and help with technical connectivity and integrations
  • You have a real passion for solving problems in healthcare
  • You're a phenomenal programmer
  • You possess authoritative knowledge of object-oriented design and design patterns.
  • Your database chops are strong
  • You have the willingness and ability to actively help define the scope of our work
  • You are curious about many different things, and you take the time to learn - and teach your colleagues what you have learned
  • You have stellar critical thinking skills - in terms of helping us attain our ambitious marketplace objectives, yes - but also in helping us deliver on our mission of helping patients reach better outcomes. We're serious about this.

Nice-to-haves:

  • SOAP web services
  • Understanding of SSL/TLS, SAML
  • MS SQL Server
  • General (light) DBA-type competencies (rebuilding indexes, etc.)
  • Debugging queries, diagnostics with execution plans, SQL Profiler, etc.
  • Python
  • WCF
  • AWS/EC2
  • FHIR
  • ETL - Lots of experience writing tools and services that process a variety of different data formats, including clinical formats. If you're experienced in working with lots of different formats - and have been in the trenches of gnarly data integration exercises - we would love to have a conversation with you.
  • Clinical IT expertise, including one or more of the following: EMRs/EHRs and integration projects involving them; Clinical Terminologies (ICD-9/10, HCPCS, SNOMED, RxNorm etc.)
  • Interest in collaboration with clients as design partners
  • DevOps

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

About CareEvolution

CareEvolution makes a Health Information Exchange (HIE) software platform and applications that run atop that platform. Our software helps healthcare providers and patients make better decisions faster. We're looking for talented mobile software engineers to join our team in solving some of the most difficult problems in HIE.

CareEvolution's platform is used in five statewide exchanges in the US, as well as many more large regional exchanges.  We also have other large public and private exchange networks, as well as health plan exchanges in active deployment.

Our team is quite small - and all of us are technical people. We maintain a strong start-up/hacker culture. CareEvolution has partnered with a few large companies with relationships in all 50 states - and beyond - to supply a large portion of our sales and marketing efforts.  Our software is recognized by leading industry analysts as the most technologically sophisticated HIE on the market - by a significant margin.

We are focused and execute very quickly. But we also have a lot of fun - regular visits to the bar, daily ping pong games, boardgame nights in the office, hackathons every eight weeks for pet projects, biannual company-wide get-togethers, rock climbing nights, disc golf days, karaoke... etc. We are also a very family-friendly organization. We have constant, active teleconference for all of our remote employees (all remote people must live somewhere in the US or Canada) - which comprise about two thirds of the CareEvolution team.

Check out our company page to the right, and visit http://letsfixhealthcare.com for more information on what we do.

Benefits

Management-less environment
Work from anywhere
Competitive Salary
401K & Defined Benefit
Strong Partnerships
Flex Time
Hackathons every 8 weeks
Talented coworkers
Biweekly post-work get-togethers
This work actually matters

items.title: Lead .NET Developer - Virtual / Remote at OutMatch (Dallas, TX)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Human Capital Management, SaaS, Workforce Analytics
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

How does it feel to be a valued contributor in a highly collaborative team of elite technical talent?  Join us and find out!  At OutMatch culture is not something we “create”, it’s something that we attract by finding people that want the same things in life. It’s the character of each individual that defines us. It’s our values and motivations that bind us. It’s something that each member of our team has the privilegeand the responsibility to help define and nurture. Collaboration is the foundation of our company, and we’re looking for smart individuals who are self-motivated and passionate to join us. When you work with us you will join a fast-paced team that has maintained a highly effective startup culture. We value passion, delivery of high quality software and the drive to continuously learn and improve.  If you think you have what it takes, WE WANT YOU!!!  At OutMatch you will participate in design, development, testing, debugging and configuration of web based and Mobile friendly software products/applications. You will have the opportunity to be part of the development team which is chartered with designing and building our next generation talent assessment system. Additionally, you will provide leadership and guidance to your team through coaching and mentorship towards successful project delivery, by maintaining high standards of code quality, following best practices and leading by example. As a member of our team, you will... 

  • Lead a team of developers through the design, development, enhancement and support of service-oriented web based and Mobile web based SaaS applications using Microsoft technologies, ASP.NET MVC/WebApi, JS libraries and MS SQL Server Databases 
  • Lead a remote agileteam in software engineering best practices for the full software development life cycle, including adhering to coding standards, setting up and maintaining builds for continuous integration; designing and coding enterprise framework components; and performing code reviews in a fast-paced agile environment. 
  • Engage with the entire IT organization in the continuous improvement of the full SDLC, SDLC tools and processes. 
  • Solve complex technical problems and design solutions while following best practice guidelines 
  • Assist in driving the team through grooming and generating quality user stories that form the basis for design and development
  • Assist with configuration of solutions to meet unique customer requirements. 

…And most important, you will immerse into a culture of collaboration, contribution, and fun!   Our ideal Candidate will have..  

  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline. 
  • Ability to think abstractly & conceptually
  • 8+ years of strong experience with designing and developing multi-tier applications using Microsoft .NET technologies. 
  • 2+ years as a Development Team Leader, mentoring and guiding team members. 
  • OOP / Object / Component oriented design and programming. 
  • Service-oriented design and implementation (SOAP/REST)
  • MVC and MVVM front-end design and development with frameworks such as Kendo UI, knockout.js, Angular JS or similar
  • Knowledge of XML, HTML5, JavaScript, CSS scripting languages
  • Experience with creation and publishing of NuGet packages a plus
  • Experience with devOps concepts and continuous integration tools including setting up builds and deployments to web servers.  Experience with MSBuild and nAnt a plus
  • Solid understanding of Database design, implementation and interaction from code, preferably SQL Server experience.
  • Fluent Entity Framework experience a plus. 
  • Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills. 
  • Experience working withremote/off-shore team membersa plus. 

U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time.  You are going to love our benefits!  Our salaries are competitive and grow to match your development and contribution. 
We have annual bonuses! 
We offer a 401(K) retirement plan with company match! 
We cover all benefits costs for our employees (medical, dental, vision, life and disability) Additional dependent coverage can be purchased. 
We have a very generous vacation policy! All new employees receive OutMatch stock options, and have plenty of opportunities to earn more! 
Additionally, while working as part of a broad team of IT professionals you will have the opportunity for self-improvement and skill growth through collaboration, mentoring, and training. 

OutMatch: http://www.outmatch.com

About OutMatch

OutMatch is an innovative SaaS and consulting company providing talent selection and people development solutions to organizations worldwide. Focusing on person-job-organization fit, our assessment-based solutions help our clients attract, select, develop and promote talent resulting in improved business outcomes. For more than 25 years, OutMatch has assessed millions of people in a broad spectrum of industries and positions spanning 42 countries and supporting 16 languages. Our solutions include: selection process design; competency modeling; entry-level assessments; competency-based professional, management and sales assessments; hiring manager interview guides and eLearning; leadership development programs; 360° feedback; succession planning; executive assessment and coaching.

Benefits

Liberal Time Off Policy
401K With Company Match
Comptetive Salaries
Work Life Balance
Annual Bonuses
Company-paid health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance
Employee Stock Option Program
Mentoring/Training
Remote Optional
On-Site Fitness Center

  • Work on the latest online engagement technology

Powerfront is looking for expert C# developers to support our engagement unique platform - INSIDE.

We use a complement of the latest HTML5 & MS Technologies like C#, SignalR,  .Net and SQL Server to build a new type of Customer Service Solution.

We are a dedicated, passionate and close knit team with technology running through our veins. We are reinventing the world of web Customer Engagement software; we are not developing small applications. We have developed software that transforms the way companies run their online business. You will use the latest technologies. Every day, you will be challenged. A career at Powerfront is your opportunity to become a leader in the future of the software industry.

Our Platform is used by Tier 1 Companies worldwide including Staples, Neiman Marcus, Toys”R”Us, Adidas, The Honest Company, Rooms To Go, GE Money and others. This is the caliber of companies you will be communicating with.

  • Build out new communication channels with Wechat, iMessage, Twitter and Facebook.
  • Improve Integration with 3rd Party systems like Salesforce, Zendesk and other CRM/Chat solutions.
  • Liaise with our Customers to provide technical support.
  • Manage and liaise with our international development team to deliver bug fixes and feature requests originated from our Customers.


Values we look for

  • Fully engaged with our Company and our Customers
  • Honesty, Caring, Self-Improvement, Confidence, Fun, Productivity and Toughness.
  • Showing an eagerness to grow and learn more about the business. This includes asking questions, reading, modeling others, and being open and responsive to feedback/areas of improvement.
  • Exhibit professionalism and commitment to role, the company and creation of the product.
  • Hard Worker not afraid of sometimes burning the candle at both ends

Required Qualifications

  • Possess at least a Bachelor/College Degree in Engineering, Computer/Telecommunication or equivalent from a reputable University
  • Excellent experience and working knowledge of .Net C# 4.5+

About Powerfront Pty Ltd

We are the creators of INSIDE, a cloud based customer engagement solution that enables brands to target and engage visitors on their website, just like a bricks-and-mortar retail store. INSIDE is used by Ecommerce, Digital, Marketing and Customer Service leaders to increase website performance, enhance campaign engagement and reduce customer service costs.

Based in Los Angeles and Melbourne we service an impressive list of clients that spans the entire globe. We have designed and built hundreds of websites on our own proprietary CMS, and are equipped with a team of eCommerce and digital experts tasked with ensuring our customers achieve online success.

We have dedicated the last 15 years to helping our clients meet their digital objectives and have evolved from a leading eCommerce Content Management System provider into a digital solutions powerhouse.

Work remotely

Fun & Creative Environment

items.title: Experienced C# Developer Who Is Ready to Take the Lead at ClearPoint Federal Bank & Trust (Batesville, IN)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Banking, Financial Services, Insurance
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

JOB BRIEF:

We are seeking an experienced professional who will provide systems design and development expertise
in support of ClearPoint’s recordkeeping system and website. Along with responsibility for the day-to-day
functioning of these platforms, this position will be key in planning for and maintaining their viability as
ClearPoint looks to expand its use of customer interactive technology. The position offers the
flexibility to work remotely.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Partner with ClearPoint management to understand business needs for new or modified systems and website functionality and features
  • Conceptualize, design, develop, test and implement proprietary software solutions based on identified business needs and established process methodologies and tools
  • Create and maintain thorough and complete systems documentation for audit support, business understanding, and simplification of ongoing systems maintenance and design
  • Provide ongoing systems support, troubleshooting and resolving all application, UI, and database related issues in a timely manner
  • Make recommendations for business process improvements with an understanding of technical problems and solutions as they relate to the technology needs
  • Proactively monitor, maintain and enhance existing systems to optimize performance, keep pace with changing business needs and reflect technology advancements
  • Consistently demonstrate initiative, sound judgment, strong technical skills, attention to detail, and exceptional customer service in fulfilling all responsibilities of the position

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in Computer Science or Computer Engineering
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience in software development including unit, systems, and regression testing frameworks
  • Demonstrated understanding of object-oriented programming, UI design, and architectural design schemas for scalable web-based applications
  • 3+ years programming experience in C# with knack for writing clean, readable, and reusable modules
  • Familiarity with Microsoft Visual Studio 2015 and SQL Server Management Studio including integration services (SSIS) and reporting services (SSRS)
  • Familiarity with .NET, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, PHP, Chrome Development Tools, Fiddler, and Postman
  • Understanding of GIT, NPM and Jenkins application management tools
  • Self-directed and results oriented with strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Excellent written and oral communications skills
  • Experience in trust or funeral services industry a plus

About ClearPoint Federal Bank & Trust

Thriving on a solid foundation of experience and dedication, ClearPoint is an industry leader in providing fiduciary, investment management, recordkeeping, and reporting services, with regulatory and compliance expertise.

ClearPoint is dedicated to serving professionals looking for an experienced partner that delivers value, a competitive return on investments, and provides time saving services, all under one roof.

ClearPoint, an industry leader in funeral and cemetery trusts, was founded in 1998 as Forethought Federal Savings Bank, a division of Hillenbrand Industries, and has operated as an independently owned Bank since 2007.

On January 1, 2014 Forethought Federal Savings Bank changed its name to ClearPoint Federal Bank & Trust (ClearPoint).

Today, ClearPoint serves customers in 43 states and the District of Columbia. Our federal charter, and associated order, give us the authority to provide funeral and cemetery trust related services in all 50 states, consistent with each state’s regulatory requirements.

We continue to experience growth year over year, both organically and through new opportunities. We serve large corporate firms and independently owned firms of various sizes.

As a result of ClearPoint’s sole focus on the funeral and cemetery industry, we truly understand the needs of our client funeral homes and cemeteries, as well as the needs of their customers. Delivering peace of mind is our top priority and it’s why so many companies have selected ClearPoint as the financial institution to provide funeral and cemetery trust related services.

Ability to work remotely
Focused yet fun-loving work environment
Business casual attire with casual Fridays
Bonus potential in addition to salary
Paid vacation & sick leave
Paid holidays
401k with company match
Medical, dental, and vision insurance
Life insurance
Educational assistance

items.title: Senior mathematically strong developer to excel our 3D house model at The Sustainables BV (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Industry: 3D Models, Consulting, Solar
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

At The Sustainables you are in a unique position to apply your skills and knowledge towards building products which help making people’s houses more sustainable. Our main product is https://homeqgo.nl - personalized sustainable energy advice shop, including (but not limited to) the following projects:

AdviceService - backend API responsible for finding the right energy products advice for a customer across ~300 000 options.

RemoteQuote - an application used by solar panel installers, insulation companies and others to remotely measure the exterior of buildings in images, design an appropriate system and create a detailed quote in less than 5 minutes.

HouseModel - complex R&D project responsible for generating 3D model of the house based on LIDAR point cloud and other data sources.

You will be working on our most challenging and critical project - the 3D house model generator. It includes developing and applying algorithms for the 3D model generation, inventing quality metrics (so we can be sure that our model measures up to our high standards), improving the architecture and advocating for high-quality code. There will also be a lot of opportunities to work on other projects so you can improve your skills in multiple directions.

What we offer

  • A lot of freedom and responsibility
  • High pace, short development cycles
  • Flexibility in the use of tooling and techniques
  • Simple and stable development process (yet we are never done improving it)
  • Opportunity to work on different kind of projects to polish your skills
  • Flexible working hours, or partially working from home
  • An informal environment and motivated colleagues
  • Every Friday to end the week together Kick-boxing by Jessey
  • Every day free team lunch

Skills & requirements

  • Experience with 3D geometry/modelling (preferable) and/or
  • Experience with CV libraries (OpenCV, Point Cloud Library, etc) and/or
  • Strong mathematical skills (especially in geometry) and ability to apply them quickly to our domain
  • .NET stack experience (we use .NET 4.7 and Core, host our solutions in Azure) or a strong desire to learn it
  • Databases experience (we use SQL Server, Mongo, Redis)
  • Strong software engineering skills, and a desire to keep learning
  • Team player
  • Experience working (remotely) in Agile Scrum Environment
  • Nice to have: a university degree in a scientific/technical field

About The Sustainables BV

The Sustainables B.V. was founded in 2011 with the mission to make de-central sustainable energy affordable and attractive for everyone. We are a young, smart and ambitious team creating innovative solutions. Our solutions eliminate the hurdles for large scale sustainable energy uptake by eliminating existing complex non-transparent customer processes. By operating predominantly in the traditional housing market our solutions are often game-changing. Our team consists of developers, housing specialists, sustainable energy specialists, engineers and economists. We serve conscious companies and consumers who realize that fossil fuels are finite and innovative energy solutions are critical for both the planet and future economic growth. We realize our ambition by supporting our business clients with our Software Platforms and hands-on experience through our Sustainable Consulting services.

Benefits

Close to the city center and public transport
Colleagues always in for (water)sports
Flexible
Very spacious office
Boxing every Friday
